clinical_study.brief_title: A Survey to Evaluate Diabetes Management, Control, Chronic Complications, Psychosocial Aspects of Diabetic Subjects in India
clinical_study.official_title: A Cross-Sectional Survey to Evaluate Diabetes Management, Control, Complications, Psychosocial Aspects of Diabetic Patients in India and to Evaluate Perceptions and Practices of Physicians and Patients About Diabetes Management in India (DiabCare India 2011)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted in Asia. The aim of this observational study is to evaluate the current status of diabetes management, control, and complications in diabetic subjects in India. Perceptions and practices of physicians and subjects about diabetes management will also be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean age of onset of type 1 diabetes mellitus
Mean age of onset of type 2 diabetes mellitus
Mean duration of treatment of type 2 diabetes mellitus
Percentage of patients on Insulin therapy
Percentage of patients on Oral Anti-Diabetics Drug (OADs) therapy
Mean duration of diabetes in type 1 patients
Mean duration of diabetes in type 2 patients
Percentage of patients archiving HbA1c target below or equal 6.5%
Percentage of patients archiving HbA1c target below or equal 7.0%
Percentage of patients having complications (dyslipidemia and hypertension, cardiovascular complications, peripheral vascular disease, diabetic nephropathy and diabetic eye complications)

intervention.description: Patients will fill out a questionaire by interview.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with diabetes mellitus (both type 1 and type 2) being treated at general hospitals, diabetes clinics and referral clinics will be selected according to inclusion and exclusion criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients should have visited the centre at least once in the last 3-6 months apart from the initial visit
- First twenty patients of diabetes visiting the centre during the data collection period
- Patients willing to sign the informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Repetition of any patient as patients should not be included twice for any reason
- Unwilling to participate or unable to comply with protocol requirements
